processSteps.title: 10. Grand Opening
processSteps.description: Launch with events and monitor performance

processSteps.title: 9. System Setup
processSteps.description: Set up supply chain and POS systems

processSteps.title: 8. Staff Recruitment & Training
processSteps.description: Hire team and conduct training sessions
processSteps.position: top-14 left-0 md:top-0 md:right-0 -translate-x-1/2 md:translate-x-1/2 text-left

processSteps.title: 7. Online Marketing
processSteps.description: Build website and prepare promotional content
processSteps.position: top-16 md:top-16 left-0 translate-x-0 md:left-0 md:-translate-x-1/5

processSteps.description: Create floor plans and kitchen layout

processSteps.title: 4. Branding
processSteps.description: Design logo, visuals, and menu layout

processSteps.title: 3. Legal Permits
processSteps.description: Register business and obtain required licenses
processSteps.position: top-12 -right-12 translate-x-0  md:top-0 md:right-0 md:translate-x-1/2 text-right

processSteps.title: 2. Location Selection
processSteps.description: Analyze locations and finalize lease agreements

processSteps.title: 1. Business Plan
processSteps.description:
Define target customers, develop menu,
and create financial plan

landingPage.processTitle: you got an idea to start your business?

projectsList.title: Sword Master Noodle
projectsList.subTitle: Korean Noodle Restaurant
projectsList.desc: Consulting, Branding (BI), Interior Design, Recipe Development, Managed and Operated
projectsList.projectText: Gogogi was founded through the collaboration of three creatives from Korea: an electronic musician, a fashion stylist, and an interior designer.The concept was not to create a simple dining space serving Korean food, but rather to establish an experiential space where food, aroma, spatial design, and music come together in harmony.

designText.designDetail: RThe project began with the demolition of existing wooden panel walls, shelves, and kitchen equipment that were left behind. Structural materials such as wooden beams and waterproof plywood were repurposed to create new shelves and a bar table.

- Upcycled furniture found through zu verschenken was repurposed as tables. - A mix of vintage designer chairs (Arne Jacobsen, Charles & Ray Eames, Philippe Starck, Castelli Plia) and lighting (Gae Aulenti, Harvey Guzzini, Gino Sarfatti) was curated to complement the space. - While maintaining a vintage mood, modern materials like LED line lighting, stainless steel, and colorful acrylic were selectively incorporated to create a comfortable yet contemporary ambiance.

aboutUsPage.titleBootom: a Berlin-based studio offering business consulting and interior design. With deep experience in launching and running F&B ventures — from branding to build-out — we bring your ideas to life in spaces that work and inspire.
